direction.raw_text: Dramatically lit by sunlight filtering down from the surface. A dim shape, massive, threatening, swims towards us from the distance. Then it divides -- what was one is two, and the shape becomes reality; two divers in Scuba gear swimming side by side. They are wearing minimal rubber, considering the cool New England waters: "Farmer John" wetsuits with cut- off legs, assorted sport-diving paraphernalia, including an expensive camera with a flash attachment. One motions "Down there," the other signals "OK, I see it," and they dive deeper, into darker waters, where the shafts of sunlight pour into the depths, broken up by seaweed and floating vegetation into cathedral-like columns of illumination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wreck of the working fisherman's boat "ORCA," formerly under the command of the late Captain Quint, deceased these four years. Buried in the sand near it, still connected by rusting strands of cable, the mangled remains of a shark cage, glimmering with stainless steel highlights. A fitful flash of yellow from under a mossy beard -- a battered barrel, similarly tangled. The divers, Bert and Ernie, appear. They're fascinated by the find, and Bert, with the camera, snaps a few flash shots. The rapid sequence of flashes signals the presence of a motor drive camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Distant flashes, obscured by vegetation in the foreground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ernie is exploring the abandoned cabin; doors open and shut, moved by invisible currents stirred by his passage. An occasional "Flash!" lights up the bottom as Bert continues snapping away souvenir shots of this local landmark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CAMERA VIEWFINDER (PROCESS) Ernie floats up out of a hatch, sees the camera, and strikes a pose, clowning for the photographer's benefit. A big hand, f.g., motions him up into clear water for a formal portrait. He obliges. Now he floats in front of us, gently paddling his flippers to maintain vertical stability. One flash. Another. Then a large, dim movement in the b.g. Something's out there, moving towards us. Flash. It's bigger, bearing down like a train in a tunnel. Flash! It's on us. Flash! Teeth? Blood? Flash! Blackness, Death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The camera floats gently down and settles in the sand. A dark red mist eddies by. A last weak flash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flash! An expensive cabin cruiser, the "Diver Working" flag fluttering limply in the breeze, is riding alone at anchor. Flash! A distant lighthouse beacon winks at us. The boat rocks in the ceaseless swell. On the stern, "Elizabeth T. - Newport, R.I." A long way from home...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A blue-and-white police jeep is bouncing over the sand. A figure in civilian clothes driving alone on some urgent mission. It's Martin Brody, Chief of Police on Amity. The jeep slows to a stop, and he takes a flight of stairs leading to a concrete patio two at a time. A classical trumpet solo is playing in the background. Brody charges through a door, then abruptly slows and starts moving warily through a hotel interior: The Holidome, a three-story extravaganza of a motel, where some sort of formal ceremony is already in progress. A banner announces: "Grand Opening Ball -- Amity Scholarship Fund Benefit." Brody crosses under a High School band, arranged dance-band style on a balcony; the trumpet player, Polo, is finishing his solo, the assembled crowd applauds politely. Brody is taking his place with some dignitaries on the dais, as the presiding authority, Amity Mayor Larry Vaughn, begins speaking.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Paul Lohman, for that eloquent solo. Now, for that point in the ceremonies where we formally dedicate this magnificent resort- hotel complex, a worthwhile addition to the recreational paradise we call Amity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Seated on folding chairs, wearing their good suits, several of Amity's Selectmen, Real Estate Developer Len Peterson, and Ellen Brody, very chic. Brody slips into the vacant chair next to her. The following is conducted in urgent whispers, sotto voce, while Vaughn drones on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couldn't help it. Hendricks over there... (he indicates his deputy) ...still has the keys to the jeep in his pocket, and I couldn't find the spares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Terrific. Act as if you've been here all along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How'm I supposed to do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look bored. VAUGHN (droning along) Holiday Inn joins the Amity Shores development condominium complex in a welcome expression renewed interest in Amity Island as the hub of the Northeast Recreational Vacation Wonderland. We're happy once again to be in the center of things, where the action is... We've had our share of hard times and long winters and the past few years have not been easy. But today, the sun is rising on a new Amity, a new island filled with promise. (applause) Len Peterson's Amity Shores Development is an exciting addition to our island. The Holiday Inn we stand in is likewise a new friend who we welcome as family. Amity means 'friendship' and our community extends its friendship to all who seek her shores in peace and harmony. (applause) Brody settles into polite attentiveness, acknowledging a wave from Hendricks, a politely bland young town cop in his idea of civilian finery. Hendricks is fussing with the banner on an attractive young lady in a bathing suit...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can see that. Don't you know this is a big deal?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ...And now, Tina Wilcox, this year's Miss Amity, will cut the ribbon that officially opens this luxurious new hotel... Tina (the girl in the bathing suit) escapes Hendricks' attentions, and teeters on high heels towards the ribbon, while Phil Fogarty, the local photographer, snaps away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Tina was selected from more than 20 of this island's lovely young ladies in the Miss Amity competition held every spring, and she'll represent Amity Island in the Miss Massachusetts Competition in Worcester next month. When she cuts this ribbon, she will be opening our island to growth, to development, to planned expansion with full employment for our thriving community.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Paul Lohman ("Polo" to his friends) is exchanging whispers with Lucy, a flute player nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy nods, Polo shrugs, and turns to Jane, a girl nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods happily, they whisper together, while we:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think she's such hot stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When are we going out? You and me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, Jane -- you want to dance as soon as we get out of these monkey suits?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Martin and Ellen have been joined by their youngest son, Sean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Applause from the crowd, Len takes a bow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mom, Michael won't talk to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Ellen) Shouldn't he be at home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This money tree, you may have noticed, is made entirely of twenty-dollar bills, donated by Len Peterson, the builder of Amity Shores Condominiums, as a gesture of goodwill towards the community. $500 as a special gift to the Amity township scholarship fund...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: as she reaches out with the scissors. Something catches her eye, and she winks at her boyfriend, Ed Marchand, smirking in the crowd. He winks back, and makes "Cut it" motions with his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tina cuts the ribbon, and Tom Andrews, a local diver, pushes a decorated float out into the pool; sparklers sputter, balloons drop from the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The band swings into "Downtown," and the crowd gets up to dance, to eat, and to break into small groups to talk.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks to Tom Andrews, of Amity Aqua- Sports, for contributing the special decorations. And now, the Amity High School band. Refreshments on the patio, everyone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ellen is dragging Brody over to where Len Peterson and Larry Vaughn, the mayor, are in conversation. They pass vignettes: Tina and Ed, Tom Andrews and Jane, Marge, other interesting Amity townspeople.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He beckons over their heads to Larry Vaughn, Jr., a young man uncomfortable in his correct tie and blazer. They exchange perfunctory greetings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts his arm around her, a little too familiarly for Brody's liking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And she hands Sean off to Brody, leaving him with an over- active 10 year old, while she's gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sean nods and runs off, happy to have a mission.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (seeing Peterson and Vaughn) Do I have to talk to those two?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My boss and your boss. Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, hello. It went well, I thought.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, thank you. You know my son, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The speech was right on the money. (to Ellen) Be a love and make sure the bar's open, will you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Fantastic lady. Don't know what I'd do without her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking around) Y'know, Brody -- for the first time in years it's worth putting money into this town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All of us thank you, okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NEAR THE BAND He is talking to Brooke Peters, a mop-maned teen-ager with a pleasant face. Timmy Weldon, a grade behind, lurks nearby. A plumpish, curly- haired buddy, Andy Nicholas, is enjoying a cup of punch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sean finds them, and bursts into their group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tugs at Mike's sleeve; Mike allows himself to be dragged off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy and Brooke are left standing together, Tim moves in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On her shrug, as she turns to Andy:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not crazy about blind dates.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're okay, if they got little white canes and tin cups.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell. (to Mike) Did your mom put all this together?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is she responsible for the punch?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My cousin will be here tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Michael, Michael, Dad said to find you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brooke) Want to dance? (she shakes her head "no") Okay. Later?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's later; night has fallen, the band is playing its version of "When I Fall in Love." Many teen-agers are dancing out on the patio, some adults are dancing inside, the buffet is ravaged, Timmy is watching Brooke, who's dancing with Polo. Douglas Fetterman ("Doug") joins him, after asking Marge for a dance and striking out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob Burnside, a tall pal of Larry Vaughn Jr.'s, turns up by their side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He exits, on the prowl.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're crazy. She's Ed's girl friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doesn't hurt to ask. Sometimes the most beautiful girls are the loneliest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Same tired old faces. You see Vaughn?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Larry Vaughn Junior? (Doug shrugs) If you see him, tell him I got a six- pack, a blanket, and the Brebner twins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: None at all. (pause) I wonder what the Brebner twins are doing tomorrow night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Can you take a little time out from your busy schedule to dance with the old man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And sure enough, they are -- the band has turned to a Fifties slow-dance standard: "I Wish You Love." Peterson approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They slowly fox trot out onto the terrace. Both of them nodding greetings to townspeople and kids -- everyone knows the chief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The music and the summer moon are working their magic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He dips with her; they look up and notice Sean, sound asleep on a bench.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He crosses to the sleepy Sean and hoists him with a grunt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sean murmurs sleepily and hugs his dad. Mike, dancing with Marge, waves good-bye. The Brodys start to leave, passing a bucket with a bottle of champagne still in it. They exchange a look, nod agreement, and Brody boosts the bottle, sneaking it out of the building while Ellen giggles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry, I'm all booked up... (taking Ellen) Come, m'dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And how. I thought you wouldn't respect me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen -- what are you doing later?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the kid) You're getting a little big for this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brody and Ellen are snuggling under the covers while early morning light streams under the blinds. It's The Morning After, and the clothes from the night before are scattered all over the room. Brody rolls against Ellen, spoon-fashion, morning-horny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They start to move a little, then turn face to face. Outside their door, the sounds of little feet; Sean padding downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their bodies move under the blankets. There's a crash from the kitchen. They stop for a beat. As they resume, little feet return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His feet paddle off. Brody and Ellen start to slide together, passion resumes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bigger feet go downstairs; Michael's up. The Brodys kiss, trying to ignore the sounds of spirited discussion between brothers over who's responsible for spilled milk. Then the sound of a car pulling into the driveway, and a horn beep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They try to kiss again, there's a door slam downstairs, and talk between the boys and Mrs. Silvera. The Brodys look at each other and break up laughing at the morning, and themselves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The milk fell out of the 'frigerator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whispering) Put a towel down. And shh -- daddy's sleeping.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Ellen and Brody, with the practice of 18 years of marriage, swing back-to-back, and put their feet on the floor, each on their side of the bed, still chuckling, up for the day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AMITY STREET   DAY The police jeep is driving through the picturesque streets, Brody behind the wheel, Ellen and Sean passengers. It slows near the foot of the street, dockside, where a real estate office marked "Amity Shores Development, Leonard Peterson, Pres." sits. Peterson's big Cadillac is parked illegally at the curb. It has the Amity Shores logo on its side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody is out of the car, his pad in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peterson, in shirt-sleeves and a tie, hustles out of the office
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellen kisses Brody, and starts in for her day's work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peterson shrugs and goes inside his office. Brody's attention is drawn by some noise by the dock.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Heck of a way to treat a taxpayer. (to Ellen) Don't you have any pull with the chief, here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (taking the ticket) Better get a sales kit together for after lunch. I'm taking some prospects out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Can't we fix it up to get this made into a green zone or something?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hendricks and an old codger, Red, are working on Amity's newest bit of police equipment; a blue power launch for patrolling local waters. The boat is Hendricks' personal pride and joy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Red complies, Hendricks spots his boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a hoot from a passing boat horn. Sean waves happily.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Red) Tie it off on your left. Your other left!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (walking onto the dock, Sean tagging along) Aren't you off-duty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Till noon. This is on my own time. (to Sean) Hi, Shorty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It has slowed to a halt in front of the police berth; it's a scruffy working fisherman, back from the banks with a full load. The Skipper hails Brody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hendricks nods, and starts the engine importantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While Red grumbles, Brody and Sean are walking up to the street. Michael and some teen-agers are headed down to the dock.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You got a gold-plater drifting in the main channel. Big cruiser.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Off the Point. No running lights, just a diver's flag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (aside to Brody) Want me to run out there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then check it out. I'll be in the office.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cast off your bow line. And your stern line. Spring line...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It's Mike, Polo, Patrick, Lucy, Brooke, Ed and Tina.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mike nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets into his jeep, leaving Sean with the teen-agers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The others ad lib appropriate greetings/good-byes, as Brody drives off in his jeep.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No place special. Just hanging out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Kids busy themselves with their boats while Sean hovers around Mike, who's not happy at baby-sitting his kid brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyone want to sail to the lighthouse?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Machs nix to me.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got one...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I go too? MIKE No. SEAN Please. MIKE I said, 'No.' Tina's in her boat, "Tina's Joy," a neat sloop. Mike is going over his "Green Machine," a sleek catamaran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before Sean can protest further, Mike spots his crew: Andy Nicholas, a round-faced, frizzy-haired pal, wearing a bathing suit, and carrying some scuba gear from an early-morning diving class. Marge and Denise, two other divers, are with him, with their gear. They ad-lib "good-byes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sean mopes away while Andy and Mike get their boat ready for sea.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going out right away, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want you to meet my cousin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to go out with you. You need a crew, don't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't need you. Andy's here.

dialogue.raw_text: Same as always -- glub-glub, bubble- bubble, stroke-stroke. There sure is some weird shit on the bottom of the ocean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mostly old garbage. Today we found a '48 Hudson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do I have to play with the little kids?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Up on the street, where a pretty girl with a sexy face and a provocative post-pubescent walk is asking him directions. He points down at the dock. The Girl, Jackie Peters, waves at her cousin, Brooke.

direction.raw_text: One of the boats has a portable radio going. It's playing some medium-hot salsa. Jackie does a couple of dance steps on her way down the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that? Quick -- I'm in love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the four teen-agers come together in a tight quartet, the music rocks up and we:

dialogue.raw_text: Over here. I want you to meet somebody.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with Mike, Andy, Jackie and Brooke.

direction.raw_text: He sheets in, heeling the boat over in the stiff breeze.

direction.raw_text: overtaking Mike's boat. It's piloted by Larry Vaughn, Jr., the Mayor's Son; with him is his good friend, Bob Burnside.

direction.raw_text: : FUN AT SEA The sailboats cutting up, cruising the harbor, the local teen-agers partying with each other:

direction.raw_text: Patrick and Lucy's Sol Cat, flying its hull.

direction.raw_text: Susie's Laser heeled 'way over' in a stiff breeze.

direction.raw_text: NEAR THE ORCA - DAY Silent, green-blue depths. A diver, Crosby, working the bottom, running a search pattern. Another diver, Tom Andrews, running close. They signal to each other, and make another pass. Follow Tom Andrews as he skims the bottom, near the wreck of the Orca, half-buried in the silt. A diver's line runs up and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobbing on the surface are three boats: the Amity Police launch, the deserted Elizabeth T., from Newport, flying a diver's flag, and the ScubaVue, a local diveboat operated by Tom Andrews and his partner, Crosby; it has "Amity Aqua Sports" lettered on it somewhere. Hendricks and Red are on the deck of the police boat, peering at the cruiser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sudden eruption in the water nearby startles them -- it's Andrews, surfacing, holding up the underwater flash camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crosby pops up next to him, shows empty hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The divers head for their boat, Hendricks fires up his engine, and we:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Rich or poor, it's nice to have money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Happens every season -- someone takes off. Once we had a schooner for a month while the owners went fox hunting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brody is trying to reason with an indignant fat man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody is caught in the open.

direction.raw_text: Albert keeps coming around when I'm with gentlemen friends and he throws mud on their cars...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (eager to be heard) Every time there's an out- of-state car in my driveway, I lose another mailbox. Those little iron sailboats cost thirty-two dollars each!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hendricks has entered, carrying the camera brought up from the bottom by the divers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They go into Brody's inner office; the uproar continues behind the door, but it's calm in here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hendricks puts the camera in an informal "Lost & Found" box sitting in the office. Brody makes the mistake of opening the door, revealing the White-Haired Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chief, I've been telling Mrs. Prendergast that it's no good just talking about Albert, she's got to do something...

direction.raw_text: Look -- the township is responsible for protecting life and property, and my property is unprotected... As Brody turns to deal with the mess, we: CUT TO:

dialogue.raw_text: (leaving in a huff) So call the FBI!

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks. What else is out there?

direction.raw_text: Looking up at the surface, where a hull floats in silhouette against the daylight. There's a commotion, and a water ski drops into view. Then another one. Pale legs churn the water.

result.heading: "WHEN IN AMITY, ENJOY THE HOLIDAY INN

direction.raw_text: Brody is alone in the jeep, headed for the safety of home and family. He drives past the town's billboard: it's covered with an architect's rendering of the Amity Holiday Inn. The sign reads: "WHEN IN AMITY, ENJOY THE HOLIDAY INN." Plastered across it is an added streamer: "NOW OPEN." Barely visible underneath are older notices: "UNDER CONSTRUCTION," and "OPENING IN JUNE." As Brody passes the sign, he impulsively swings off the main road and heads down towards the beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody is on restless patrol, checking the water's edge as he continues on home. As he drives along, he sees: a clambake; some teen-agers in a group, necking and dancing; and a few solitary surfcasters and fishermen. The beach is deserted, the sun is setting, and Brody and his jeep have the sand to themselves. It's then that he sees something:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A big bow section of a ruined, burnt boat is bobbing in the surf just off the beach ahead. It's a piece of the waterskiers' boat; Brody heads towards it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Brody slows his jeep just short of the water, and gets out to look at the flotsam. His shoes get wet. He backs up onto dry sand, then tries to edge closer to examine this object. It bobs up and down in the surf; Brody makes "Get in here" motions. The junk resists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No response. He takes off his shoes and socks, and rolls up his trouser legs. A silly sight. He wades into the water after it.
